verses.verse: But king<WH4428> Solomon<WH8010> loved<WH157> many<WH7227> strange<WH5237> women,<WH802> together with the daughter<WH1323> of Pharaoh,<WH6547> women of the Moabites,<WH4125> Ammonites,<WH5984> Edomites,<WH130> Zidonians,<WH6722> and Hittites:<WH2850>

Of the nations<WH1471> concerning which<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> to the children<WH1121> of Israel,<WH3478> You shall not go<WH935> in to them, neither<WH3808> shall they come<WH935> in to you: for surely<WH403> they will turn<WH5186> away your heart<WH3824> after<WH310> their gods:<WH430> Solomon<WH8010> joined<WH1692> to these<WH1992> in love.<WH160>
And he had<WH1961> seven<WH7651> hundred<WH3967> wives,<WH802> princesses,<WH8282> and three<WH7969> hundred<WH3967> concubines:<WH6370> and his wives<WH802> turned<WH5186> away his heart.<WH3820>

For it came<WH1961> to pass, when<WH6256> Solomon<WH8010> was old,<WH2209> that his wives<WH802> turned<WH5186> away his heart<WH3824> after<WH310> other<WH312> gods:<WH430> and his heart<WH3824> was not perfect<WH8003> with the LORD<WH3068> his God,<WH430> as was the heart<WH3824> of David<WH1732> his father.<WH1>
For Solomon<WH8010> went<WH3212> after<WH310> Ashtoreth<WH6252> the goddess<WH430> of the Zidonians,<WH6722> and after<WH310> Milcom<WH4445> the abomination<WH8251> of the Ammonites.<WH5984>
And Solomon<WH8010> did<WH6213> evil<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of the LORD,<WH3068> and went not fully<WH4390> after<WH310> the LORD,<WH3068> as did David<WH1732> his father.<WH1>

Then did Solomon<WH8010> build<WH1129> an high<WH1116> place for Chemosh,<WH3645> the abomination<WH8251> of Moab,<WH4124> in the hill<WH2022> that is before<WH5921> <WH6440> Jerusalem,<WH3389> and for Molech,<WH4432> the abomination<WH8251> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon.<WH5983>
And likewise<WH3651> did<WH6213> he for all<WH3605> his strange<WH5237> wives,<WH802> which burnt<WH6999> incense<WH6999> and sacrificed<WH2076> to their gods.<WH430>

And the LORD<WH3068> was angry<WH599> with Solomon,<WH8010> because<WH3588> his heart<WH3824> was turned<WH5186> from the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> which had appeared<WH7200> to him twice,<WH6471>

And had commanded<WH6680> him concerning<WH5921> this<WH2088> thing,<WH1697> that he should not go<WH3212> after<WH310> other<WH312> gods:<WH430> but he kept<WH8104> not that which<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> commanded.<WH6680>

Why the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> to Solomon,<WH8010> For as much<WH3282> <WH834> as this<WH2063> is done of you, and you have not kept<WH8104> my covenant<WH1285> and my statutes,<WH2708> which<WH834> I have commanded<WH6680> you, I will surely rend<WH7167> the kingdom<WH4467> from you, and will give<WH5414> it to your servant.<WH5650>
Notwithstanding<WH389> in your days<WH3117> I will not do<WH6213> it for David<WH1732> your father's<WH1> sake:<WH4616> but I will rend<WH7167> it out of the hand<WH3027> of your son.<WH1121>

However,<WH7535> I will not rend<WH7167> away all<WH3605> the kingdom;<WH4467> but will give<WH5414> one<WH259> tribe<WH7626> to your son<WH1121> for David<WH1732> my servant's<WH5650> sake,<WH4616> and for Jerusalem's<WH3389> sake<WH4616> which<WH834> I have chosen.<WH977>
And the LORD<WH3068> stirred<WH6965> up an adversary<WH7854> to Solomon,<WH8010> Hadad<WH1908> the Edomite:<WH130> he was of the king's<WH4428> seed<WH2233> in Edom.<WH123>

For it came<WH1961> to pass, when David<WH1732> was in Edom,<WH123> and Joab<WH3097> the captain<WH8269> of the host<WH6635> was gone<WH5927> up to bury<WH6912> the slain,<WH2491> after he had smitten<WH5221> every<WH3605> male<WH2145> in Edom;<WH123>
(For six<WH8337> months<WH2320> did Joab<WH3097> remain<WH3427> there<WH8033> with all<WH3605> Israel,<WH3478> until<WH5704> he had cut<WH3772> off every<WH3605> male<WH2145> in Edom:<WH123>)

That Hadad<WH1908> fled,<WH1272> he and certain<WH582> Edomites of his father's<WH1> servants<WH5650> with him, to go<WH935> into Egypt;<WH4714> Hadad<WH1908> being yet a little<WH6996> child.<WH5288>

And they arose<WH6965> out of Midian,<WH4080> and came<WH935> to Paran:<WH6290> and they took<WH3947> men<WH582> with them out of Paran,<WH6290> and they came<WH935> to Egypt,<WH4714> to Pharaoh<WH6547> king<WH4428> of Egypt;<WH4714> which gave<WH5414> him an house,<WH1004> and appointed<WH559> him victuals,<WH3899> and gave<WH5414> him land.<WH776>

And Hadad<WH1908> found<WH4672> great<WH3966> favor<WH2580> in the sight<WH5869> of Pharaoh,<WH6547> so that he gave<WH5414> him to wife<WH802> the sister<WH269> of his own wife,<WH802> the sister<WH269> of Tahpenes<WH8472> the queen.<WH1377>

And the sister<WH269> of Tahpenes<WH8472> bore<WH3205> him Genubath<WH1592> his son,<WH1121> whom Tahpenes<WH8472> weaned<WH1580> in Pharaoh's<WH6547> house:<WH1004> and Genubath<WH1592> was in Pharaoh's<WH6547> household<WH1004> among<WH8432> the sons<WH1121> of Pharaoh.<WH6547>

And when Hadad<WH1908> heard<WH8085> in Egypt<WH4714> that David<WH1732> slept<WH7901> with his fathers,<WH1> and that Joab<WH3097> the captain<WH8269> of the host<WH6635> was dead,<WH4191> Hadad<WH1908> said<WH559> to Pharaoh,<WH6547> Let me depart,<WH7971> that I may go<WH3212> to my own country.<WH776>

Then Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> to him, But what<WH4100> have you lacked<WH2638> with me, that, behold,<WH2009> you seek<WH1245> to go<WH3212> to your own country?<WH776> And he answered,<WH559> Nothing:<WH3808> however, let me go<WH7971> in any wise.

And God<WH430> stirred<WH6965> him up another adversary,<WH7854> Rezon<WH7331> the son<WH1121> of Eliadah,<WH450> which<WH834> fled<WH1272> from his lord<WH113> Hadadezer<WH1909> king<WH4428> of Zobah:<WH6678>

And he gathered<WH6908> men<WH582> to him, and became<WH1961> captain<WH8269> over a band,<WH1416> when David<WH1732> slew<WH2026> them of Zobah: and they went<WH3212> to Damascus,<WH1834> and dwelled<WH3427> therein, and reigned<WH4427> in Damascus.<WH1834>

And he was an adversary<WH7854> to Israel<WH3478> all<WH3605> the days<WH3117> of Solomon,<WH8010> beside<WH854> the mischief<WH7451> that Hadad<WH1908> did: and he abhorred<WH6973> Israel,<WH3478> and reigned<WH4427> over<WH5921> Syria.<WH758>

And Jeroboam<WH3379> the son<WH1121> of Nebat,<WH5028> an Ephrathite<WH673> of Zereda,<WH6868> Solomon's<WH8010> servant,<WH5650> whose mother's<WH517> name<WH8034> was Zeruah,<WH6871> a widow<WH490> woman,<WH802> even he lifted<WH7311> up his hand<WH3027> against the king.<WH4428>

And this<WH2088> was the cause<WH1697> that he lifted<WH7311> up his hand<WH3027> against the king:<WH4428> Solomon<WH8010> built<WH1129> Millo,<WH4407> and repaired<WH5462> the breaches<WH6556> of the city<WH5892> of David<WH1732> his father.<WH1>

And the man<WH376> Jeroboam<WH3379> was a mighty<WH1368> man of valor:<WH2428> and Solomon<WH8010> seeing<WH7200> the young<WH5288> man that he was industrious,<WH6213> <WH4399> he made<WH5414> him ruler<WH6485> over all<WH3605> the charge<WH5447> of the house<WH1004> of Joseph.<WH3130>

And it came<WH1961> to pass at that time<WH6256> when Jeroboam<WH3379> went<WH3318> out of Jerusalem,<WH3389> that the prophet<WH5030> Ahijah<WH281> the Shilonite<WH7888> found<WH4672> him in the way;<WH1870> and he had clad<WH3680> himself<WH1931> with a new<WH2319> garment;<WH8008> and they two<WH8147> were alone<WH905> in the field:<WH7704>
And Ahijah<WH281> caught<WH8610> the new<WH2319> garment<WH8008> that was on<WH5921> him, and rent<WH7167> it in twelve<WH8147> <WH6240> pieces:<WH7168>

And he said<WH559> to Jeroboam,<WH3379> Take<WH3947> you ten<WH6235> pieces:<WH7168> for thus<WH3541> said<WH559> the LORD,<WH3068> the God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> Behold,<WH2005> I will rend<WH7167> the kingdom<WH4467> out of the hand<WH3027> of Solomon,<WH8010> and will give<WH5414> ten<WH6235> tribes<WH7626> to you:

(But he shall have<WH1961> one<WH259> tribe<WH7626> for my servant<WH5650> David's<WH1732> sake,<WH4616> and for Jerusalem's<WH3389> sake,<WH4616> the city<WH5892> which<WH834> I have chosen<WH977> out of all<WH3605> the tribes<WH7626> of Israel:<WH3478>)

Because<WH3282> <WH834> that they have forsaken<WH5800> me, and have worshipped<WH7812> Ashtoreth<WH6252> the goddess<WH430> of the Zidonians,<WH6722> Chemosh<WH3645> the god<WH430> of the Moabites,<WH4124> and Milcom<WH4445> the god<WH430> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon,<WH5983> and have not walked<WH1980> in my ways,<WH1870> to do<WH6213> that which is right<WH3477> in my eyes,<WH5869> and to keep my statutes<WH2708> and my judgments,<WH4941> as did David<WH1732> his father.<WH1>

However, I will not take<WH3947> the whole<WH854> <WH3605> kingdom<WH4467> out of his hand:<WH3027> but I will make him prince<WH5387> all<WH3605> the days<WH3117> of his life<WH2416> for David my servant's<WH5650> sake,<WH4616> whom<WH834> I chose,<WH977> because<WH834> he kept<WH8104> my commandments<WH4687> and my statutes:<WH2708>
But I will take<WH3947> the kingdom<WH4410> out of his son's<WH1121> hand,<WH3027> and will give<WH5414> it to you, even ten<WH6235> tribes.<WH7626>

And to his son<WH1121> will I give<WH5414> one<WH259> tribe,<WH7626> that David<WH1732> my servant<WH5650> may have<WH1961> a light<WH5216> always<WH3605> <WH3117> before<WH6440> me in Jerusalem,<WH3389> the city<WH5892> which<WH834> I have chosen<WH977> me to put<WH7760> my name<WH8034> there.<WH8033>
And I will take<WH3947> you, and you shall reign<WH4427> according to all<WH3605> that your soul<WH5315> desires,<WH8378> and shall be king<WH4428> over<WH5921> Israel.<WH3478>

And it shall be, if<WH518> you will listen<WH8085> to all<WH3605> that I command<WH6680> you, and will walk<WH1980> in my ways,<WH1870> and do<WH6213> that is right<WH3477> in my sight,<WH5869> to keep<WH8104> my statutes<WH2708> and my commandments,<WH4687> as David<WH1732> my servant<WH5650> did;<WH6213> that I will be with you, and build<WH1129> you a sure<WH539> house,<WH1004> as I built<WH1129> for David,<WH1732> and will give<WH5414> Israel<WH3478> to you.
And I will for this<WH2063> afflict<WH6031> the seed<WH2233> of David,<WH1732> but not for ever.<WH3605> <WH3117>

Solomon<WH8010> sought<WH1245> therefore to kill<WH4191> Jeroboam.<WH3379> And Jeroboam<WH3379> arose,<WH6965> and fled<WH1272> into Egypt,<WH4714> to Shishak<WH7895> king<WH4428> of Egypt,<WH4714> and was in Egypt<WH4714> until<WH5704> the death<WH4194> of Solomon.<WH8010>

And the rest<WH3499> of the acts<WH1697> of Solomon,<WH8010> and all<WH3605> that he did,<WH6213> and his wisdom,<WH2451> are they not written<WH3789> in the book<WH5612> of the acts<WH1697> of Solomon?<WH8010>
And the time<WH3117> that Solomon<WH8010> reigned<WH4427> in Jerusalem<WH3389> over<WH5921> all<WH3605> Israel<WH3478> was forty<WH705> years.<WH8141>

And Solomon<WH8010> slept<WH7901> with his fathers,<WH1> and was buried<WH6912> in the city<WH5892> of David<WH1732> his father:<WH1> and Rehoboam<WH7346> his son<WH1121> reigned<WH4427> in his stead.<WH8478>
